en.title: Do you want to continue with your divorce and apply for a decree nisi?
en.amendOrAdd: You'll still be able to amend or add to your application and change your request for a costs order if you want to.
en.readMore: Read more about the decree nisi
en.orderForDivorce: The court order for divorce (known as a decree) is made in 2 stages. You’re only divorced once both stages are complete.
en.decreeNisi: The 'decree nisi', which shows that the court agrees that you’re entitled to a divorce.
en.decreeAbsolute: The ‘decree absolute’, which legally ends the marriage. It cannot be made until at least 6 weeks after the decree nisi.
en.courtCanCancel: The court can cancel (legally known as rescind) the decree nisi at any time up until the decree absolute, if it's presented with new evidence showing why you shouldn’t be given a divorce.
en.signOutDetail: Press Continue to sign out. If you want to withdraw your divorce application, contact the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre.
